description: The GooglePlus API is the programming interface to GooglePlus. You can use the API to integrate your app or website with GooglePlus. This enables users to connect with each other for maximum engagement using GooglePlus features from within your application.

blocks.name: getAccessToken
blocks.description: Exchanging authorization codes for access tokens and refresh tokens.

args.name: clientId
args.info: A string that identifies the request origin as Google. This string must be registered within your system as Google's unique identifier.

args.name: clientSecret
args.info: A secret string that you registered with Google for your service.

args.name: code
args.info: The code Google received from either your sign-in or token exchange endpoint.

args.name: redirectUri
args.info: The URL to which to send the response to this request.

blocks.name: refreshToken
blocks.description: Exchanging refresh tokens for access tokens.

args.name: clientId
args.info: A string that identifies the request origin as Google. This string must be registered within your system as Google's unique identifier.

args.name: clientSecret
args.info: A secret string that you registered with Google for your service.

args.name: refreshToken
args.info: The refresh token Google received from your getAccessToken endpoint.

blocks.name: getUser
blocks.description: Get a person's profile.If successful, this method returns a person resource in the response body.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The access token Google received from your getAccessToken endpoint.

args.name: userId
args.info: The ID of the person to get the profile for. The special value `me` can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

args.name: fields
args.info: List specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

args.name: prettyPrint
args.info: If set to `true`, data output will include line breaks and indentation to make it more readable. If set to `false`, unnecessary whitespace is removed, reducing the size of the response. Defaults to `true`.

args.name: userIp
args.info: Identifies the IP address of the end user for whom the API call is being made.

blocks.name: getUsersByActivityId
blocks.description: List all of the people in the specified collection for a particular activity.The collection parameter specifies which people to list, such as people who have +1`d or reshared this activity. For large collections, results are paginated.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The access token Google received from your getAccessToken endpoint.

args.name: activityId
args.info: The ID of the activity to get the list of people for.

args.name: collection
args.info: The collection of people to list.`Plusoners`: List all people who have +1'd this activity.`Resharers`: List all people who have reshared this activity.

args.name: maxResults
args.info: The maximum number of people to include in the response, which is used for paging.

args.name: pageToken
args.info: The continuation token, which is used to page through large result sets. To get the next page of results, set this parameter to the value of `nextPageToken` from the previous response.

args.info: Specify the preferred language to search with.
